snippet: Many of the wireless transmission towers knocked out by Hurricane Sandy are not expected back online for several days, the Federal Communications Commission said.
abstract: Federal Communications Commission announces that wireless transmission towers knocked out by Hurricane Sandy are not expected back online for several days; says  some 20 percent of such sites in Northeast remain shutdown, largely due to power system failures.

byline.original: By EDWARD WYATT and BRIAN X. CHEN
byline.contributor: Edward Wyatt reported from Washington, and Brian X. Chen from New York.

lead_paragraph: Many of the wireless transmission towers knocked out by Hurricane Sandy are not expected back online for several days, the Federal Communications Commission said.
